cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northeast over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, reach the Florida Big Bend as a hurricane mid-week, then accelerate northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend region near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. East Coast as of Advisory #3
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. East Coast as of Advisory #3
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend) through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (3–6 inches forecast with locally higher amounts)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft inundation potential along SC coast, including Charleston Harbor)
weather_observation.wind: 25–35% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Wed into Thu with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 2–4 ft of surge into Charleston Harbor around high tide, causing minor to moderate coastal flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 3–6 inches with localized totals >6 inches, leading to flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; temporarily elevated waves/seas that can disrupt vessel movements and berth operations.
